ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Shop with Dave is awesome. You learn the basics of machining, one of the coolest crafts. Highly recommended. Dave is amazing. He knows his trade, cares about teaching, and does the perfect job of combining both.
Great course. Hands on experience that I could not have gotten from other courses in the regular Mechanical Engineering Undergrad curriculum.
i would say its a great class and you'll learn a lot i would recommend it to a friend.
A wonderfully chill class where you learn to machine, eat cookies, talk about life, and come out with a cool steam engine.
Yes, it's fun and as an engineering major it's nice to work with your hands and build something from scratch
Very helpful for an experimental physicist. I would recommend this class to another student.
I would recommend other students to take this course. Machining is very helpful and very useful skill to have. David does a very good job in teaching the course.
Recommended, it is a lot of fun.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Gave me the necessary hands on learning experience and the machine shop exposure.
i now have skills that i can use to help advance my research for the rest of my life.
It introduced me to an entire new skill set that has already proven to be very useful in my research.
This course highly contribute to my machining skills. It is highly important for my research since I have to machine or communicate with others on designing parts for experiments.
